hanzi-su-wiki:
糧

Значения

Пища, провизия

Мнемоника

Натуральный налог, нормированное 量 количество зерна 米 пища.

Варианты

粮

heisig_chinese_memo: Imagine Japanese army provisions like obentou boxes, always containing the same quantity of rice.
heisig_constituent: provisions, rice, quantity, nightbreak, sun, day, one, floor, computer
koohiiStory1: Imagine Japanese army provisions like obentou boxes, always containing the same quantity of rice. (thanks darg_sama, emphasizing quantity and the nuance of food "rations", "food supply": the kanji also appears in "military provisions" and "army rice").
koohiiStory2: All Japanese provisions contain a certain quantity of rice... they eat it with just about every meal!
jp_example_words: 食糧(しょくりょう): provisions, rations
jp_readingExamples: 糧食 (かてしょく), 糧道 (りょうどう), 糧 (かて)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The rice that's prepared at dawn by the village are provisions for the army. The army is scheduled to arrive right after dawn, so all of the villages provisions for them have to be ready by then.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture everyone in the village getting all of their rice together as provisions for the army. Even the kids and old people are helping out.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Once all of the provisions are ready, the soldiers show up in their row (りょう) boats and load it all up. But they aren't done there. "Rice isn't enough, we need roe (ろう) so we will have the strength to row our row boats back." And so the village brings them all of their roe too.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture the soldiers gobbling down their provisions of rice and roe in their row boats as they row away.
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), 日 (день), 米 (рис), 里 (родная деревня)
Ru_trainchinese: liáng: (сущ) зерно, пища; налог зерном
Kanshudo_mnemonic: you measure (量) the rice (米) for provisions
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The villagers saw the halo of the angel appear in the distance.  The angel gave them rice, the only provisions being that all the villagers live peacefully with eachother.
humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze inscription starts with " rice ", " quantity " sound, the original meaning is food.

The upper part of the inscription " liang " starts with " quantity " and the lower part starts with " rice ". The upper three strokes of " rice " overlap with the lower three strokes of "量". Both "Shangbo Bamboo Slips" and "Guodian Bamboo Slips" inherited their writing methods. The font of "Jiudianjian" is changed to the left " m " and the right " quantity " structure, which is the same as Xiaozhuan.

Bronze writing is used as the name of the person, Yitong Yu: "Zhe (Xu) Wang Jiliang's Sun Yitong."

The original meaning of bamboo slips in the Warring States period refers to food. "Shangbo Bamboo Book Five. The Admonitions of Bao Shuya and Xi Peng" Jane 3: "Mu is short, the field is long, and the hundred grains (bell)." "The hundred grains bell" is the tax on the farmer's private land, which means that one bell of Baishi grain is paid (Peng Ho). The whole sentence refers to the measurement of the private field boundary and the measurement of the public field boundary in order to implement the taxation system of Baishi grain tax for one minute.

"Said Wen": "Grain, grain. From the rice, measure the sound." Duan Yucai's note: "The Poetry says: "It's wrapped in rice grain." "Zhuangzi" says: "Those who are suitable for a hundred miles can sleep in the grain. Those who are suitable for a thousand miles gather grain in March." It is also called the way. Xu Yun's "grain food" is also the saying of the person who lives together. The grain is originally a generic name, so it is not an analysis."
humanum_short_description_en: Bronze inscription starts with " rice ", " quantity " sound, the original meaning is food.
humanum_full_description:
金文從「米」，「量」聲，本義是糧食。

　　金文「糧」上部從「量」，下部從「米」而「米」字上三筆與「量」字下三筆重疊。《上博竹書》與《郭店竹簡》皆繼承其寫法。《九店簡》字形改為左「米」右「量」結構，與小篆相同。

　　金文用作人名，宜桐盂：「䣄(徐)王季糧之孫宜桐。」

　　戰國竹簡用其本義，指糧食。《上博竹書五．鮑叔牙與隰朋之諫》簡3：「畝纆短，田纆長，百糧箽(鍾)。」「百糧鍾」是農夫所得私田的稅項，意為百石糧食納稅一鍾(彭浩)。全句指的丈量私田田界，丈量公田田界，以實行百石糧食納稅一鍾的賦稅制度。

　　《說文》：「糧，穀也。从米，量聲。」段玉裁注：「《詩》云：『乃裹餱糧。』《莊子》云：『適百里者宿舂糧，適千里者三月聚糧。』皆謂行道也。許云『穀食』，則兼居者行者言。糧本是統名，故不爲分析也。」
humanum_short_description: 金文從「米」，「量」聲，本義是糧食。

食糧(しょくりょう): provisions, rations

金文從「 米 」，「 量 」聲，本義是糧食。 金文「 糧 」上部從「 量 」，下部從「 米 」而「 米 」字上三筆與「 量 」字下三筆重疊。《上博竹書》與《郭店竹簡》皆繼承其寫法。《九店簡》字形改為左「 米 」右「 量 」結構，與小篆相同。 金文用作人名，宜桐盂：「䣄(徐)王季糧之孫宜桐。」 戰國竹簡用其本義，指糧食。《上博竹書五．鮑叔牙與隰朋之諫》簡3：「畝纆短，田纆長，百糧箽(鍾)。」「百糧鍾」是農夫所得私田的稅項，意為百石糧食納稅一鍾(彭浩)。全句指的丈量私田田界，丈量公田田界，以實行百石糧食納稅一鍾的賦稅制度。 《說文》：「糧，穀也。从米，量聲。」段玉裁注：「《詩》云：『乃裹餱糧。』《莊子》云：『適百里者宿舂糧，適千里者三月聚糧。』皆謂行道也。許云『穀食』，則兼居者行者言。糧本是統名，故不爲分析也。」
Bronze inscription starts with " rice", " quantity" sound, the original meaning is food. The upper part of the inscription " liang" starts with " quantity" and the lower part starts with " rice". The upper three strokes of " rice" overlap with the lower three strokes of " 量". Both "Shangbo Bamboo Slips" and "Guodian Bamboo Slips" inherited their writing methods. The font of "Jiudianjian" is changed to the left " m" and the right " quantity" structure, which is the same as Xiaozhuan. Bronze writing is used as the name of the person, Yitong Yu: "Zhe (Xu) Wang Jiliang's Sun Yitong." The original meaning of bamboo slips in the Warring States period refers to food. "Shangbo Bamboo Book Five. The Admonitions of Bao Shuya and Xi Peng" Jane 3: "Mu is short, the field is long, and the hundred grains (bell)." "The hundred grains bell" is the tax on the farmer's private land, which means that one bell of Baishi grain is paid (Peng Ho). The whole sentence refers to the measurement of the private field boundary and the measurement of the public field boundary in order to implement the taxation system of Baishi grain tax for one minute. "Said Wen": "Grain, grain. From the rice, measure the sound." Duan Yucai's note: "The Poetry says: "It's wrapped in rice grain." "Zhuangzi" says: "Those who are suitable for a hundred miles can sleep in the grain. Those who are suitable for a thousand miles gather grain in March." It is also called the way. Xu Yun's "grain food" is also the saying of the person who lives together. The grain is originally a generic name, so it is not an analysis."

糧字的基本解释

糧
liáng
见“粮”。

糧字的汉语字典释义

[①]［liáng］
［《廣韻》吕張切，平陽，來。］
亦作“1”。“粮1”的繁体字。
(1)谷类食物的总称。亦指出行所携食粮。
(2)指田赋。

糧字的康熙字典解释

【未集上】【米字部】　糧； 康熙笔画：18； 页码：页913第07
【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】呂張切【正韻】龍張切，?音良。【說文】穀食。【周禮·地官·廩人】凡邦有會同師役之事，則治其糧與其食。【註】行道曰糧，謂糒也。止居曰食，謂米也。【左傳·僖四年】申侯曰：共其資糧屝屨。【疏】糧謂米粟，行道之食。【詩·大雅】乃裹餱糧。【莊子·逍遙遊】適百里者，宿舂糧。適千里者，三月聚糧。　又藥名。【神異經】禹餘糧，世傳禹治水，棄其所餘糧于江中，生爲藥草也。　亦作粮。

糧字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
糧字的起名意思

暂无。

["Guangyun" Lv Zhangqie, Binh Duong, come. ]

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Uncollected first] [Mi Zi Department] 　liang; Kangxi strokes: 18; page number: page 913 page 07
[Guang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] Lu Zhangqie [Zheng Yun] Long Zhangqie, good sound. [Said the text] cereals. 【Zhou Li·Di Guan·Lin Ren】Fanbang has the task of meeting with the division, and then governing its food and food. [Note] The way to go is to say food, that is to say 糒也. Zhiju said food, said rice. [Zuo Zhuan·Xi Four Years] Shen Hou said: Sharing his resources. [Sparse] Grain is rice millet, the food of Taoism. 【Poetry·Daya】It's rice-wrapped food. [Zhuangzi·Xiaoyaoyou] Those who are suitable for Baili will stay in the food. Those who fit thousands of miles, gather food in March.　Also the name of the medicine. 【Mystery Classics】Yu surplus grain, it is handed down that Yu governed the waters, discarded his surplus grain in the river, and was born as a medicinal herb.　Also used as food.

Name meaning

liáng
вм. 粮
Radicals: 米, 旦, 里  (rice, dawn, village)
Meaning Mnemonic
The rice that's prepared at dawn by the village are provisions for the army. The army is scheduled to arrive right after dawn, so all of the villages provisions for them have to be ready by then.
Picture everyone in the village getting all of their rice together as provisions for the army. Even the kids and old people are helping out.
Reading Mnemonic
Once all of the provisions are ready, the soldiers show up in their row (りょう) boats and load it all up. But they aren't done there. "Rice isn't enough, we need roe (ろう) so we will have the strength to row our row boats back." And so the village brings them all of their roe too.
Picture the soldiers gobbling down their provisions of rice and roe in their row boats as they row away.
